alert.note: Alert for Coastal Indian River; Coastal St. Lucie; Inland Indian River; Inland Southern Brevard; Inland St. Lucie; Mainland Southern Brevard; Okeechobee; Osceola; Southern Brevard Barrier Islands (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 3:19PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern St. Lucie, Okeechobee, Indian River, southeastern Brevard and southeastern Osceola Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 318 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Kissimmee Prairie Preserve, or 13 miles south of Lake Marian, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Palm Bay, Fort Pierce, Sebastian, Vero Beach and Fellsmere. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
